description: From Middle English gainstanden, corresponding to gain- +â€Ž stand. Compare againstand.

verbs.description: gainstand (third-person singular simple present gainstands, present participle gainstanding, simple past and past participle gainstood)

entries.meaning: (transitive, UK dialectal) To stand against; resist, oppose; withstand.
examples: He perceived three French Gentlemen, who alone, with an incredible and undaunted boldnesse, gainstood the enraged violence, and made head against the furie of his victorious armie.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, UK dialectal) To make or offer resistance.
